instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight
threads.message:
I get image folder on screen but no backlight
<CHIP>U7701</CHIP>: 9-10 12.58v, 17 3.3v, 19 0v, 21 0v, 8 5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight
threads.message:
You forgot pins 5, 18, 11.
Low level on pin 11 (if is the case) should generate some voltage at <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>.
Do you get something there?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight
threads.message:
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<CAPACITOR>C7718</CAPACITOR>[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT] was 0v and it was shorted, but the short is coming from the LCD connector, ordered some already. 

Thanks for the help amigos!
